author: r3s6714
title: great army builder
review:
Since this is a small set I won't be doing my standard pros/cons review.

This is a really nice set. It has some really cool new pieces. Among the new pieces are the red crowbar, the backpack, the new robber torso. Not a new piece but the buggy driver policeman's torso has new back printing. It also comes with a black lightsaber hilt which was only included in the Indiana Jones set Race for the Stolen Treasure. The ATM and buggy are nice and gives the set some nice things to play with.Overall this is great set and is good for army building.

author: CRACKOTATOE
title: New police caps?
review: Maybe you've noticed, maybe you've not. A lot of the new 2011 Police Officers seem to have regular caps instead of Police ones. Why's this? Dunno about you but I don't like it. It's too civilainly, if you know what I mean. Police Officers should be unique and have proper uniforms.

author: just2good
title: Nice little set
review:
Yesterday, I got this set at Toys'R'Us for $10. Here is my review for this nice little set.

Pros+:

  • Comes with a comic!
  • Includes four minifigures, plus German Shepard
  • Crowbar
  • Nice white hat

Cons-:

  • A bit pricey (should be about $6)
  • Only 57 peices
  • Doesn't include a dog bone
Overall, if you like LEGO City, you should get this set, and if this set is on sale, you should also get it.

author: aplbomr79
title: Little money - lots of mini-figs.
review:
Overall Rating

For the overall rating, I have to give it 5 Bricks as you get 4 Mini-Figs for a low cost.  Add in the value for another ATV, a Doberman Retriever, and an ATM - this set is more than exceptional!

Building Experience

There is not much build here outside of the ATV (4-Wheeler).  There is the Automatic Teller Machine, but that includes all of 5 pieces.

Parts

Included in this set is a new RED CROWBAR!  That along with Minifig Robber Torsos, Skull Caps, Money, and a backpack (satchel) and this set really expands the arsenal.  New dog design anyone?  I love the Doberman.  Purchase a couple of these sets and the Dobermans can watch over your 'junkyard' of miscellaneous pieces.

Playability

Two policemen, two robbers, and a dog.  The possibilities.  Add in the ATM (a feature that expands any city scene) and another build for ATV's and this set is out of control!  LEGO did an incredible job - hopefully this is just a teaser for what is to come.

Value

Did I mention 4 mini-figs, a new dog, and an ATV yet?  For $10 usd, this set is well worth the money!  I will gladly spend the cash for 4 mini-figs alone.  

I think that I will be buying another set for multiple reasons!

author: TopperTwist
title: Great Battle Pack
review:
Opening:

 This set is pretty good for only $10 in the US. You get four minifigures and a police dog. With a few accessories.  If you want the point of this review: I think this set is worth getting for the police dog and backup money pecies and figures, but not for the accessories.

Figures:

 I think the remade old police torso with back printing is great to see again. It's also nice getting a black lightsaber hilt and an extra cop. However, all the criminals in Lego City are the same, escaped convicts with red crowbars, facial hair, and a beanie, stealing money. How original. It's good to get some criminals, but I don't like getting the same criminals in prisoner uniforms. BTW the new German Sheopard dog peice is awesome!

Accessories:

 This makes the set cruise downhill. The quad looks like that toy you always wanted but never got when you were 7. The ride-on car. Exactly what the police quad ressembles, but uglier. And the ATM looks unrealistic and strange. But we do get 2 money peices...

Closing:

 This set would be perfect for $7. $10 is kind of pushing it. If they just dropped the price to seven bucks and ditched the quad and ATM, this set would be spectacular. I would reccommend you get one for the figures, crowbar, backpack, and doggy! How ever this set is a lot for a little, it's still sliding past the 'worth it' line.

author: coldcomfort
title: 7279 Police Minifigure Collection - Round out your cops and robbers fun for cheap!
review:
I've seen people here and elsewhere say that they feel this set is a bit overpriced. I must respectfully disagree. Yes, the quad bike is a bit rudimentary but it's a decent looking space filler in the equipment lot behind your police station or at the very least a good little pile of useful bricks, bearings, wheels and tires. Who can't use more of that stuff? At any rate, in my eyes the ATV is a freebie because what this set is really about is the four minifigures.

I've been looking around for some inexpensive minifigures this week because I only have a small handful. What I have found is that you simply can't get a minifigure anywhere that I've seen for less than $2.50 - more when you include shipping. The way I see it four minifigures at a minimum of $2.50 each is the $10 USD price tag of this set. All the other neat little things included with them are just gravy - and good gravy at that!

I really like the shepherd and I think the ATM will look plenty realistic enough outside a convenience store or the like. It's easily on par with the phone booth from the 8402 Sports Car set.

This is a great little set that is almost a gift to the collectors from Lego because it's such a good value.

author: Roketah
title: Short And Simple
review:
I got this set for $12 today and its awesome. the best thing is all the new or rare parts.

also no stickers :) 4-5 figures if you include the dog....

author: BobaFett2
title: This...is....EPIC
review:
This is pretty much a battle pack. But it's a lot cooler-than just a battle pack. It's not just one side-it's both.

Box/Instructions

The image is simple. I've seen better presentation.

Parts

The set has numerous parts that I got it for. First off, there's a crowbar piece-LEGO is really losing some of it's old morality-now they have evil-ish criminals, guns, etc...anywas. We also get a sack that's effective for carrying stolen cash! That's new! Lastly, we have dollar bills and a more intricately printed police dog.

Minifigures

They're awesome. You get two criminals, both very realistic (although I doubt that real criminals would wear their jail clothes in public) and two police officers with great uniforms. I just wish they still had police on the helmets like they used to.

The build

It's simple-but it's a battle pack. The vehicle was nothing new, and neither was the ATM.

The completed model

Again, there's not much about it. But it looks pretty decent. I think the vehicle could have been done in a better way, but as it stands it's not half bad.

Summary

This is a great set. Anyone wishing to expand your police/criminal collection-buy it. Anyone who has a city-get it. Anyone who really wants the money bag-this is the cheapest way to get it.

author: CharlieTheFunEngine
title: TinyTurbosCityAndToyStory Reviews Episode 23: Police Minifigure Collection
review:
When I first saw pictures of this set I wanted it just for the ATM, but now that I have it I realize it's a source for lots of great parts.

Building Experience:

Mediocre. The vehicle takes up most of the build time.

Parts:

Heaps of new parts for my collection including the new-style dog, handcuffs, crowbar, rucksack, bank notes and knit caps.

Playability:

Unbelievably playable with hundreds of pose for the minifigures and countless stories to create!

Value for Money:

I paid AUD$15 for this set and despite everything that's still a bit much...

Overall:

Great new pieces for my collection and surprisingly playable.

author: AETerry
title: Police Minifigure Collection
review:
At $9.99, this set is comparable to other Battle Pack collections and the 8401 City Minifigure Collection of 2009. Compared to the Star Wars Battle Packs, it is cheaper by about $2 due to lack of Liscense for a name brand and fewer bricks by constract for the minibuilds in the Battle Packs.

 

I will say for certain that this Minifigure Collection is by far better then the City Minifigure Collection as there aren't any extra signs to "pad" out the set and feel like wasted bricks. That's probably changing my opinion now after over a year and giving better thought to these sets and reviews.

 

At 4 minifigures in the pack, 5 when you include the dog you have a good assortment of figures to work with. 2 Policemen, their K-9 unit and 2 Crooks. Already there's lots that can be done with just that. The Cops are decent with sporting a new style for their uniforms while still being able to integrate with older sets/fleets/squads of Police minifigures. The crooks are a bit stereotypical with the stripped shirts and cell room numbers on them. I suppose it's a gimmick or trick that works for younger children in identifiying the bad guys.

 

There's plenty of new accessories, many of them are new such as the red crowbar and satchel. The crook's sport beanie caps and the Cops, one of them carries an interesting use for a lightsabre handle as a flashlight and instead of one pair of handcuffs, I've got two so both crooks can be properly apprehended.

 

There's a small ATV style Police Car that's a fairly standard build making decent use of elements and doesn't try to do anything unsual with the build. It's simple and honest. The other small build is that for the ATM machine complete with cash inside which I enjoy seeing and makes for a wonderful little addition to a City/Town scene.

 

The instructions aside from the new standard of giving a listing of what elements are in the set and a Customer Service number should there be any problems, has a fun little comic for children to look at it. There's also a code for unlocking secret content on various LEGO sites/areas related to the City Police theme. As well as an ad for the upcoming Lego City Video game and three pages for the current Lego City themes for 2011 Police, Shuttle and Fire.

 

I can see where a child will have many hours of play with just this for a starter set or adding it to other City themes they may already have. For AFOL's who've been around the block a few times and have seen a large number of police sets over the years, this isn't bad for trying to give a fresh look at the Police theme and one that's pretty much a tried, true and tested standard & must for a City collection.

author: nivracer
title: go get them
review:
I got this set at walmart in TX for $9.99.

the atv is great i realy like how they put the roll cage in the back and the handle bars are .

tha atm is small but good to yut in front of the police station, bank or by the road. it comes with 2 robers, 2 $100 tiles, a sack 2police men, 2 handcufs (,1 extra), and 1 light. and it has a police comic in the back of the instructions.

get this set to compete the police sets.

author: av8r1973
title: Expand your police force for just a little cash!
review:
What a great little set to add to your collection.  Yes, I agree with many reviewers that there are really too many police vehicles and sets.  I believe my city is one of the safest in the world as a result - and I don't even have a police station yet.

While each set comes with some cops, and even some bad guys, it's great to have extras not assigned to any specific kit.  The new printing on the torso was nice for the quad rider, but a standard new face and helmet.  

The crooks each had unique torsos, one with a suit jacket on over his prison stripes.  The standard black wool caps were included.  I would love to see bad guys that weren't wearing prison stripes.  Perhaps some grungy sweats, a trench coat, or something a bit more menacing.  With all the cops in my town, it's a bit embarrassing to see all these escapees running around.  :)

The new German Shepherd is great.  It's a truly new piece, not to be confused with other dogs.  He'll go nicely with the yet-to-be-purchased K9 unit set.

The ATM was just a couple of parts, but it will add some value to the city.

One last good thing was a complete lack of stickers!  Police logos were printed on the tiles and the ATM was a standard CRT monitor.  An extra pair of cuffs were included in my set, too.

Pretty good value (US$12 here in Taiwan) for the minifigs and some extra components in your city.  It's worth getting if you are looking for some new recruits.

author: lego_fan_242
title: A good impulse city set.
review:
Box/Instructions

The set comes in a normal city box with an action scene on the front. The instructions are easy to follow, as always, and have a comic in the back of the book.

Parts

There are many good parts in this set. There is the ATM machine, the two money pieces, the red crowbar, the knapsack, the dog and the torch. That is why I bought this set, along with the fact that I needed more policemen and criminals. However, the price to piece rating is pretty high, as I bought it for 15 dollars, so I was a bit hesitant to buy it. Minor Con.

Minifigures

The set comes with 4 minifigures and the dog.

THE CRIMINALS

The one with the jacket and crowbar 4/5

The one with knapsack 3/5

THE POLICEMEN

The one in ATV 2.5/5

The one with the torch 3/5

Dog 5/5

The build

The build is very short,as the ATV and ATM Machine take up almost all of the building. However, it is a impulse set, so all is forgiven.

The completed model

The ATM looks awesome in a city layout, yet its always on a sort of backwards angle because it won't fit on studs properly. The ATV looks a bit small compaired to other police vehicles and I think it would be better if they raised the price a bit and put in a normal police car. Minor Con. All in all it makes for a great scene.

Summary

It is a great impulse set and would be great to add to any police layout.

author: BrickTVReviews
title: ATM Robbery? No Way When The Police Are Here!
review:
Welcome brickfans to again another review by BrickTVReviews and today we're gonna review set# 7279 Police Minifigure that costs $9.99 and now we're gonna do a pros/cons review once again.

Pros

-ATM machine! FINALLY!

-2 $100 bricks, wow if I was the minifig i'll be rich right now!

-The minifigure holding the flashlight is awesome.

-Cool new crowbar piece!

-RUCKSACK!

-New police dog with detailed printings.

-New crook design! 

-Sleek Design on the police ATV.

Cons

-NOTHING!

                              

                                   And that's why you should buy this set! Its a great addition to any LEGO City and I am looking forward to see more of the 2011 LEGO City police sets. I give it a 10/10! BrickTVReviews signing off and have a good day everyone! :) ^_^

author: Huge_Nerd
title: Bad Boys, Bad Boys, whatch gonna do, whatcha gonna do when they come for you?
review:
I got this set for a gift a while back and I really like it. I'm not a big City fan, but the robbers in this current City line just ooze character. The two included in this set are no exceptions. You've got the cool one--who I figure is the leader--and the crazy one with the gold tooth. I especially like their hats, which are probably also good for dock or waterfront workers. The police are nothing special, but they make good straight-man foils for these robbers. There are some nice accessories too, like handcuffs, a crow-bar, and the dog.

 

This set is primarily about the minifigures, so the build is nothing special. The ATV is a fun, solid, little vehicle though and the ATM is a nice touch. Plus, one can never have too many money tiles! The fun little comic at the end of the instructions is a nice bonus.

 

Anyway, this set is well worth the price! Highly recommended.

author: taffer1979
title: Almost skipped this set.
review:
I avoided this set for a long time, but when it went on sale for $7.99 I couldn't pass it up. The 4 wheeler is kinda dumb to me and it is the main build in the set. I really liked the ATM, which is awesome. The crooks are very cool with the knapsack/money and red crowbar.

Pros

  • ATM/Money
  • Crooks/ Crowbar
  • 5 Minifigs (2 Crooks, 2 Police, 1 Dog)

 

Cons

  • Viechle (I never seen the police on one of those)
  • Only 1 ATM

This set nicely expands your crooks in the city and if you dont have the bank gives them something to rob. This would be a good starter set for a 4-year old.

author: ilovelego777
title: Police Minifgure Collection
review:
It took me long to get this set since I get tempted with the Collectible Minifigures Theme. Right now, I am falling behind since there are no too many nice Lego themes. I got this set on my birthday.


Pros

Pro 1. 4 minifigures: 1 police officer, 1 police driver and 2 crooks
Pro 2. Has an ATV or a Quad bike
Pro 3. Comes with ATM machine and 2 $100 bricks
Pro 4. Comes with a backpack, crowbar, flashlight, and handcuffs
Pro 5. New dog design


Cons

Con 1. It might get a little expensive. In the Philippines, this retails Php800 or 1000


It's a great set to be added to your city and your police force. It has a lot of details and accessories that can be used for other things like the crowbar as a weapon. I recommend that you get this set.

author: Harmonious_Building
title: Crime and punishment.
review:
What a surprise, another opportunity from LEGO to add another litany of cops and robbers to the city, an intimately intertwined pair of occupations that surely account for a good 50% of all city-dwellers. Your philosophical question for today is as follows: did the city hire an army of policemen to combat the crime wave in the city, or are the citizens rebelling against civil society because they are sick of 24/7 surveillance? You and your child will surely spend long hours debating the merits and pitfalls of each side of this dichotomy, and what an educational opportunity it will be to cite various seminal philosophical works in order to justify your varied points of view!

What’s that? You don’t see this as being a particularly realistic scenario? Well, fine then, guess I’ll just review the set. I had no real intention of ever picking up Police Minifigure Collection; being in the possession of a number of recent police sets already, I figured that I had already had my fill. Then there was a confluence of events: I had a small bit of money left over from an Amazon gift card, and it was being sold at 10% off, so I says to myself, I says, why the heck not.

I won’t bother insulting your intelligence by telling you what you get in this set since it’s all perfectly clear from the box art. Other than the Minifigs (and the dog), the two primary builds here, if you will, are the strange police ATV and the ATM, the latter of which is easily incorporated onto the “sidewalk” of any of the buildings of City Corner (7641). It’s a simple and elegant build and I suppose will appeal to folks who have fantasies of lifting an entire ATM away. The ATV, however, leaves a lot to be desired and is frankly pretty ugly, although it may find a home for people who intend to collect the 2012 “forest ranger” sets or who have some other kind of rugged theme going on in their displays. Perhaps it could serve as a proxy “police car”, since Bank & Money Transfer (3661) and Car Chase (3648) and both a tad pricey and hard to find.

All in all, I would not have bought this set had it not been offered at a heavy discount to me, which it was. Unless you truly feel as though your city is lacking in law enforcement personnel, I would recommend giving this set a pass and accumulate policemen through other “proper” sets, if you will. I’m not disappointed, though, because my Gangster (8805) is always looking for cannon fodder for his crew.

author: Mr__Minifigure
title: Good to build your minifig collection with...
review:
I received this set as a gift a few months ago. After having it for a while, I can say these things about it: 

Pros

  • The 4 minifigs with assorted accessories.
  • The new style-dog (first set I got with this new dog in it).
  • ATM with money.

Cons

  • The main part of the build, the ATV, is clunky in design and oversized.

My overview: It's worth getting for most people, unless you have no need for more minifigs. (But c'mon, who doesn't need minifigs?)

author: What_Sup_Lego_Fans
title: 7279 - Police Minifigure Collection
review:
The police minifigure collection is a set that comes with 57 pieces and 4 minifigures. It costs $10 nz dollars. Lets find out some highs and lows.

Box/Instructions

The box is small and it comes with 2 bags. It also comes with a instruction booklet. The instructions are easy to follow.

Parts

There are some useful parts  in this set. The dog was a nice addition as well as the atm machine. They can be useful for your city.

Minifigures

The best things about this set is the number of minifigures you get. You get 4 ( 5 if you include the dog ). You get 2 policemen and you get 2 robbers. The minifigures are common in police sets but this is a cheap way to get alot of minifigures.

The build

The build was very easy and it took less than ten minutes. There are no hard parts in the build.

The completed model

It comes with 4 minifigures, a ATV and a small atm. This is a well thought out set.

Overall - 10/10 ----- Well Done Lego.

author: tkettle9719
title: City Battle Pack!
review:
I got about three of these for my minifig bowling game, and think that this is a nice little set (though my custom creation using the three and the four Alien Strikers is way cooler).

Pros

  • -Classic and inexpensive cops and robbers set.
  • -Many small elements make great playable set.
  • …

Cons

  • -The buggy is a but uninspired, and doesn't have a red light.
  • -The ATM should look less like a garbage can.
  • …

This is an excellent set for little ones, and it definitely is a very playable set for all. I recommend this to all minifig lovers and children.

author: Mrconnor2000
title: Great edition to your city!
review:
Hi, our names are Connor, Harry and Harry and we are Professional Lego Reviewers. We also have a Youtube account - Mrconnor2000 - Which has lots of Lego Imformation, Reviews and more so please subscribe and rate this review 5/5.

Box/Instructions

The Box had a great front cover and had 4 alternate images on the back showing playability features. it included one main bag which had a smaller bag inside. There was one instruction manuel which had pictures of other related sets on the back.

Parts

Lots of New parts were included in this set. They are - The red crowbar that one of the robbers are holding. that new piece is a great piece for any Lego city Police fan and it can be well used in scenes in your City. Next - another new piece is the Bag piece that a robber has on his back. it can hold Lego as shown but it only has room for as much as two 1x2 tiles.

Minifigures

The Minifigures in this set included of two robbers and two policemen. The policeman on the buggy has No new items as usual except his torso has been updated a bit so it has a walkie talkie on it and a shiner badge. the other policeman has a cool but unusual new piece - a white cap. It has no printing and we think its a great edition to the police team. The robber on the Left of the box has nothing new except the crowbar which we've already talked about but the robber on the right has a light grey hat and a new torso which is the normal robber torso with a light grey jacket over the top which is really cool!

The build

The build only took about 10 minutes to make and it was very fun and exciting to build.

The completed model

The completed model was really good and we were happy with our selfs that we bought that set. The completed model has four minifigures, a police buggy and a cash machine. One problem that we had to face though, was the fact there was a sticker! the sticker went on the front of the buggy and said 'Police'. the rest was printed tiles like the cash machine screen. A great little set for anybody and for £8.49 or $9.99, its totally worth it. :)

author: BrickFactoryINC
title: Very good I had to get 2
review: This set was the start of my love for the City Police line.  This set may be small but it works well the ATV is small and works and the ATM looks like it fits in the City style but where it was the best was the figs.  2 Cops and 2 robbers with a dog being able to create different Cisneros with the characters and it can fit right into a city display.  This set is good if you are looking for a start on police try this its very good.
